title: A Boring Life
name: A Boring Life
description:
A Map by Boringlovechild

snore at will.

properties.name: 159 Otterburn Close
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The squat I legalised under a false name before it was demolished. Lived here from September 1990 - July 1992.

properties.name: 239 Harwoods Road, Watford
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild My home until I was 18 (1969-1988).

properties.name: 85 Cherbury Court
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Home for 18 months or so, October 2002 - June 2004. Lived with Daniel Moden (the brother of a colleague, Becky) and then Vicky Marsh.

properties.name: A beautiful bungee dive
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 40 metres above a pool looking out into the Pacific, Dec 31st 2000 on my Mexican holiday with Jun.

properties.name: A year at my third school
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went to Queens school in Sept 86 after I couldn\'t do the A-levels i wanted at Durrants. Stayed a year (to June 87) and never really fitted in, perhaps due to starting in Miami Vice style clothes...

properties.name: An Advancing Glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The Perito Moreno glacier is one of the few accessible advancing glaciers in the world. We watched parts fall off over a few hours and imagined how we would best exploit it for tourists (huge projector, golf targets, etc).

properties.name: Asuwa High School, Fukui City
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Worked here for the school year August 1994 to July 1995 with Kusaoke sensei and Mori sensei.

properties.name: Ate at a record-breaking restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A small restaurant on the corner of a Colonia street held the biggest barbecue in the world in 2008. We ate there 23rd April 2009.

properties.name: Awesome Glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Perito Moreno, one of tyhe world´s only accessible advancing glaciers, cracks and breaks as it moves closer to you at the rate of about two metres a day. One of those few awesome sights.

properties.name: Began supporting Deportivo
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Visited Julio here in summer 1999 and he converted me to Deportivo as my Spanish football team.

properties.name: Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Sixth November 1969, about 3am.

properties.name: Boy George told me to fuck off
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I was at the Prince Lovesexy concert in Wembley Arena in 1988. During the interval, walking around the arena I spotted the former Culture Club frontman. Wearing a \'Boy\' cap at the time I pointed and said "Boy". He was not so gracious.

properties.name: Bribed policemen
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Had been desperate to go to the toilets signed as next to the Catedral Metropolitana but when we arrived they were all closed. Went round the back to the stink of piss and shit and add some liquid. When i finished two policemen, who had come round, beckoned me over and asked for "una trata". I obliged with the sum of about 50p.

properties.name: Bungeed 134m
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jumped off the pod at Nevis, New Zealand´s highest bungy jump.

properties.name: Came where nobody had come for over a thousand years
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent time exploring the ruins of the Mayan city of Tikal with Jun in late 2001.

properties.name: Carried Jun down the world's 3rd biggest pyramid on my back
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lost a game of cards at the top of the Piramide del Sol at Teothihuacan and forfeited with a perilous descent that could\'ve cost both our lives. My legs hurt for 2 days.

properties.name: Caught a second thief
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Six months after catching a guy in Bayswater, I caught a female tea leaf on March 25th 2008. She\'d stolen from an Indian woman near Chapel Market and instead of grabbing her I just followed her with the police on the phone.

properties.name: Caught a thief
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chased and caught a tea-leaf who\'d tried to nick the bag of a colleague at work. Called the police who came and arrested him. Got a follow-up letter saying he (Anthony Leach) had\'d been convicted at City of Westminster Magistrates Court and sentenced to 8 weeks in prison. It left me with mixed feelings.

properties.name: Could´ve killed a cassowary or two
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Driving in remote northern Queensland, 2 (endangered) cassowaries stepped onto the road in front of my hired car. They didn´t stop but luckily I did.

properties.name: Decorating Miami
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Painted rooms in art deco colours in August 1998 at Kaori and Brian\'s new

properties.name: Drank in England's smallest pub
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Had a pint in the Nutshell with Jun, Sue & Allen on 21st July 2007.

properties.name: Fell for a building
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild the guard let me into Casa Battlo to take some pics from the hall (this was before guided tours of the building) but it was really the facade that did it. Went back in 2007 with Joss and bored him with my desire to photo every nook and cranny.

properties.name: First concert in a foreign country
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went over to visit Mandy Price in Paris in June 1989 and saw Prince\'s concert here.

properties.name: First helicopter flight
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Flew from Helsinki to Talinn in 18 minutes.

properties.name: First time white water rafting
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun and I went down a seemingly calm river and mocked it at the half way stage. Soon afterwards I nearly drowned trying to swim without a life jacket and Jun came off the raft as soon as we restarted.

properties.name: Floods up to my knees
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It was raining when I got off the 24-hour bus journey from Hanoi, raining when I had caught up on some sleep, raining after I stayed in all day and that night. Wading around the town, I thought I might catch a disease. I didn\'t, but I did get a lot of "War and Peace" read.

properties.name: Got to The Beach before Leonardo
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Travelled with my Aussie mate Mark in December 1993 and January 1994 and from Krabi we went to Ko Phi Phi, which is where the movie was later shot (leading to complaints from environmentalists).

properties.name: Had half my bike lock sawn through
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It nearly all went wrong the first night of my cycling trip with Orlando from Malaga to Sevile in 2004, when we woke up to find the bikes we\'d left outside almost gone.

properties.name: Handed back a riot policeman his truncheon
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The guy was forcing us back at the G8 summit on Wednesday 6th July 2005. When he stepped over a wire farmer\'s fence, he dropped his club. I thought about taking it and running but decided on the hippy way.

properties.name: Head in the Vatican
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Received in the gallery attached to St Peters in the summer of 2004.

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 2000-present. Where I live with my gorgeous wife.

properties.name: Home in Colchester, Lexden Road
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived with Chloe for six months in the converted basement of a detatched house. Colchester sucked.

properties.name: Impersonated Ross Jenkins in my briefs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild August 1994 on Gilli Trawangan. Was competing with Lindsey\'s bf to do the best version of how Jenkins used to head the ball into the net. Only problem was nobody else could judge...

properties.name: Last encounter with Chinese Police
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In the hut on the Chinese side of the bridge, I pulled out a bottle of water and sipped from it only to see the unaccounted for piece of hash that I\'d been given in Xiahe. Slipped it into my mouth and washed it down as I waited for the policeman on the other side of the table to return my passport and let me cross into Vietnam.

properties.name: Looked into the Devil´s Throat
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Saw the 275 waterfalls of Iguazu after a night of rain in early May 2009. Saw a Cayman, butterflies and birds too.

properties.name: Lost my virginity
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Easter 1987. Her name was Christine. She was from Rugby and I met and chatted her up at a chalet party on an 18 Plus holiday before taking her back to my chalet, where she said "no" and told me after (what seemed like) several hours that she was "only teasing". No meant yes.

properties.name: Magellanic and Humboldts
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Penguin watching off the coast of Chiloe.

properties.name: Mekong boat trip
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Thought I was in for a unique trip in 1995 but ended up sharing with two Canadians in their forties (as well as Laos and tribespeople who called the boat from the bank, like a taxi). The Canadians drank too much at one village stop and one came back to the boat drunk, looking for condoms and singing "pussy". The idiots were vomiting all the next day...

properties.name: Mikuni Junior High School
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Worked as a JET teacher for 2 years here.

properties.name: Mountain biked close to death
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Came down the mountain too fast in 1994 on a trip with Canadian Melissa and managed to brake at the edge of a forty metre drop. Just sat and looked over for a little while...

properties.name: My 2-bed apartment in Fukui
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here for a year while i worked at Asuwa High School.

properties.name: My Japanese Homestay
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSpent a few months at Dokkyo Daigaku and this was my home. The Nozawas are a lovely family who made me feel at home.

properties.name: My Japanese University
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildStudied here for 6 months (theoretically) from March 1997. Met Aya Isobe, who helped with my MA research.

properties.name: My PADI SCUBA Licence, Roatan.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild January 2002, did my SCUBA licence in the Carribean on a great holiday with Jun.

properties.name: My first arrest, Langmusi
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a fight with a drunk Chinese policeman, September 1995.

properties.name: My first girlfriend
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I was 8, Andrea Saunders (the daughter of my mum\'s friend since childhood) was 9 and I taught her how to jump off her swing and play dead. We had a kiss and exchanged letters intermittently for a few years, only ever meeting once again.

properties.name: My first home abroad: Sunny House 206
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I lived here for 2 years from July 1992-July 1995 when working at the junior High School.

properties.name: My first schools
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chater Infants and Chater Junior schools. Named after the do-gooder son of a local chemist.

properties.name: My first schools
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chater Infants and Chater Junior schools. Named after the do-gooder son of a local chemist. Teachers were Mrs Murtagh (sp?), Mrs Wright, Miss Davies and Mr Wheeler. I also had my most successful sporting period in my fourth year of junior school (1980-81) scoring 30-odd goals as centre forward for the school team.

properties.name: My first trip abroad
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Day-trip to Calais as a first year at senior school, 1982. Left my first pair of sunglasses on the ferry.

properties.name: My girlfriend got married
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I gave her away to the songs of The King, impersonated in this Las Vegas chapel.

properties.name: My last trip of the 20th Century, Colombia.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent 3 months in Colombia, 5 weeks of which were in Cartagena, sweating through my 30th birthday and looking for some work.

properties.name: My second arrest, University of Essex.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It weren\'t me, guv.

properties.name: My second home: YMCA, Watford
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived in room 1017 for seven or eight months in 1988. Met Stan the man, Simon, Pete (Space Cadet) and Sweaty Sock Alan. Also spent time with New Zealander Michelle (who was looking for Adam Ant) and Diane and Claire...

properties.name: My second university, U of Essex
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFirst 6 months of MA in Contemporary Japan

properties.name: My senior school, Durrants
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  1981-1986. Got 7 O\' Levels and had my first French kiss (with Joanne Phelps). Left after a week or so in the sixth form because I couldn\'t do Maths and English A Levels.

properties.name: My third arrest, Tel Aviv
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Bloody violent Israeli police attacked peaceful demonstrators with boots, knees and fists: March 2004.

properties.name: My third home
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here from 1988 to September 1989 with Sophia and Maria

properties.name: My unsuccessful DJ career
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Did a few Wednesday nights at what was then Precinct 13, spinning Native Tonuges, rap and a little ragga. Then they replaced me with someone good.

properties.name: Oak House, halls of residence
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here in my first year at Manchester University 1989-90. Shared with 7 or 8 other guys including Uppi, Gary, and two Steves.

properties.name: Offered camels for wife
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A guy in Marrakesh market made an offer for Jun, but i couldn\'t get the price (in dromedaries) I was looking for.

properties.name: Otherworldly adventure
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Spent three days and two freezing nights on a tour of the amazing Salar de Uyuni.

properties.name: Paradise with pricks
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In Novemeber 99, went from Cartagena to the national park with a mate and endured the company of an arsehole Brit and a separate arsehole American. Hammocks, tents, sun and sea.

properties.name: Picked up by Japanese police
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Mark and I were attempting to hitch to Tokyo from Fukui in 1993. We got quite far before getting stopped and taken to a bus stop by the local constabulary. Stupidly, i showed them my "gaijin card" and the whole incident was mentioned at school a few months down the line.

properties.name: Rain broke a contact lens
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Kaori, my then-girlfriend\'s contact lens was broken by a sudden downpour on the day in 1998 that Bill Clinton was debating the meaning of the "be" verb with Ken Starr.

properties.name: Ran with bulls
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Sang our version of Don´t Cry for Me
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild At the Sapporo Dome, on the cue of an off-target shot, four of us (Emma, Ben, John) in unison burst into "Don\'t cry for me Argentina, the truth is he always misses. He\'s fucking useless. He\'s fucking useless. Batistuta: what a wanker." It got more laughs on the train back, though, after we held on to a single-goal lead in the "Group of Death". 7th June 2002.

properties.name: Saw a great white (tipped reef) shark
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild On a night dive at the Great Barrier Reef, saw a sleeping turtle, a potato cod and had an encounter with a two-and-a-half metre long shark.

properties.name: Second in the county: the height of my sporting career
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Won a pink certificate for coming second at the Hertfordshire school games in the pole-vault in 1982. I was the only one of the competitiors without a fibre-glass pole (my didn\'t bend). Broke my school\'s records at the same time (for 1st to 5th year).

properties.name: Self-enforced solitary sent me slightly mad
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent five weeks reading, smoking, doing press-ups and writing in early 1996. Hardly spoke to anyone and found my brain wandering away from my head ("Zen and the art of motorcycle maintenance" didn\'t help).

properties.name: Shortest ever visit to a country
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild About 45 minutes after crossing the Nicaraguan border into Costa Rica (and changing all our money), Jun and I had to go back because they wouldn\'t accept her visa. (2002)

properties.name: Slashed with a knife
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In 2000, I sobered up on my feet face-to-face with a guy holding a knife to me. I had no recollection of how I\'d got into that situation but just asked him what he was going to do about it and walked off. Walking down York Way, I realised he had slashed my jacket: it felt like a lucky escape (and reminded me of a passage in John Irving\'s "Cider House Rules").

properties.name: Slid away from tombs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hiked up the mountain to see the looted underground vaults. It started raining and my newly resoled DMs fell apart as I tried to descend. There were a few hairy moments before I got back to tracks.

properties.name: Slow boat to China
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Left Japan from Osaka in August 1995 and arrived in Shanghai 36 hours later.

properties.name: Sperm Whale Watching
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Took a whale-watching tour and saw 3 of the enormous beasts at the surface.

properties.name: Started supporting Vasca
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Eduardo took Jun and I to a Copa Brasil match while we were staying with Andrea and him in Rio, May 2009. Vasco de Gama beat Vitoria 4-0 in the semi-final first leg.

properties.name: The furthest I've travelled for a party
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Our friend Jan celebrated his 40th in Finland. We spent time with Matt and Kung, Jan and his wife Ying, and lots of his family and friends. Guitar playing and sing-alongs made up the evenings\' entertainment.

properties.name: The horror
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildAuschwitz concentration camp, Poland. Visited with Jun in 2001 to bear witness to the final solution.

properties.name: The most I've ever won in a casino
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Well, let\'s be clear, it wasn\'t much: about £40 in July 2000 with Jun on blackjack.

properties.name: Threw myself out of a plane
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Did my first static line jump in November 2006 and my second in March 2007 at the North London Parachute Centre

properties.name: Thrown out of Genghis Khan's mausoleum
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Am I a barbarian? Just because i filmed...

properties.name: Too sexy for the catwalk
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Model for a night at Club Yellow. A friend of my homestay brother, Tomo, designed various bits of casual wear and I offered my services. They started to shave my hair but the shaver broke and i was left with a weird haircut that caught the attention of the photographers and i was (apparently) on the front of some little newspaper.

properties.name: Tried to get into prison
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Demo with Palestinian, Israeli and foreign protesters about the "prison" that the illegal Israeli occupying forces have made the Gaza strip.

properties.name: Watch the Horns win the  (then) most lucrative game in football ever
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Watford beat Leeds 3-0 in May 2006, to win the Championship Play-Off final, the single most lucrative football match in the world (to date).

properties.name: Wedding, 21st August 2002, London.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun and I tied the knot here with Gosia and Yumi as our only witnesses.

properties.name: Won (money at) the Derby
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went down to Epsom to meet Air & Rod, Jade & Oliver and some others. Won about £20 on the winner of the Derby, Alternative Future (this after winning £70 on the National earlier in the year) but was down about £13 in total on all the races of the day.

properties.name: Won a TV Quiz
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild End of June 2003 I took part in "Beat the Nation", a low budget Endemol quiz for Channel 4 that only managed one season. Twice, I beat my opponents but couldn\'t beat the nation. Third time I went out in the final round but picked up £100 with my goodbye question.

properties.name: Won a laughing competition, Malacca, Malaysia.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Won a flight to Phuket on Xmas Eve 1993. The competition was as cringeworthy as it sounds, with two guys making ridiculous noises and two gals refusing to take part once they realised what they were supposed to do. I started with a quiet chuckle to myself and built slowly up until I was on my back on the floor, kicking and punching in hysterics. Got myself a genuine laugh or two...

properties.name: Worked at the highest Irish-owned pub in the world
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Got a job at Paddy\'s (owner was named Gary) in October 2009 and worked two or three evenings until January 2010.
